security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown guidance. No executable code, no network calls, no file access beyond documentation templates. Safe for publication.

content.value_statement: Creating MCP server skills from scratch takes significant research and experimentation. This skill provides a proven template, discovery workflow, and performance best practices so you can build optimized skills in minutes instead of hours.
actual_capabilities: Create skill directory structure following MCP conventions
Discover available tools from any MCP server using CLI
Apply optimized command patterns for fast execution
Test MCP tools interactively before documentation
Follow best practices checklist for production skills
limitations: Requires MCP CLI to be installed separately
Does not install or configure target MCP servers
Cannot execute MCP commands without server availability
Skill creation workflow is for documentation only

output_examples.input: Create an MCP skill for the filesystem server that can read and write files.
output: - Quick Start section with optimized commands
- Tool discovery patterns using mcp tools
- Template for read_file and write_file commands

best_practices: Use the optimized pattern: cleanup; sleep; echo commands | timeout shell for all MCP interactions.
Include process cleanup with pkill -9 -f pattern before each command to prevent hanging.
Document all parameters with required vs optional distinction in the Key Tools section.
Test each tool interactively before writing documentation to catch edge cases.
anti_patterns: Avoid wrapping parameters in {"arguments":{}} - pass parameters directly.
Do not skip the timeout wrapper - always use timeout 30 for shell commands.
Avoid individual mcp call commands when shell mode can execute multiple commands in one call.
Do not skip cleanup steps - orphaned processes cause subsequent failures.

faq.question: What tools do I need installed before using this skill?
faq.answer: You need the MCP CLI installed via 'brew install mcp' or 'go install github.com/f/mcptools/cmd/mcptools@latest' plus your target MCP server.

faq.question: Can this skill install MCP servers for me?
faq.answer: No. This skill generates documentation and templates. You must install the target MCP server (npm, go, or binary) separately.

faq.question: What MCP servers are supported?
faq.answer: Any MCP server that follows the Model Context Protocol specification. Common examples include filesystem, GitHub, and database servers.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a documentation skill that only generates markdown files. No data is sent to external services.

faq.question: Why do commands use pkill and timeout?
faq.answer: These prevent hanging processes and stuck sessions. MCP servers can hold resources; cleanup ensures reliable repeated execution.

faq.question: How is this different from the MCP CLI guide?
faq.answer: The CLI guide is a reference manual. This skill provides a step-by-step workflow and templates for creating complete skills.
